data.title: Hot, Fresh, Authentic
data.text: Really good Indian cuisine prepared to order.  The service is fine.  Don't let the diner-like atmosphere fool you.  The food is really good.  My favorite is the Chicken Tikka Masala with some hot and fresh naan!

data.title: Great food
data.text: We regularly order take out. Last time 2 days ago. We enjoy chicken tikka masala, alo gobi snd sanbar soup. Our whole family (incl. 2 kids) likes the food. Prices are reasonable as well but be aware that they do not have a lunch menu during the week.

data.title: HORRIBLE Food
data.text: The food is very bad. I went with some friends because they wanted to try a new cuisine and the food was very oily and bland. I would not go here again.

data.title: Unexpected taste
data.text: South Indian dishes taste good but that is no surprise since everyone on staff is south Indian almost. However with any paneer recipe the taste is not what you expect. You order butter paneer and they serve something muddy colored dish. Taste isn't bad but that's not butter paneer. I have ordered couple of times always take out as there is barely any space to sit. Not going again.

data.title: It's ok
data.text:
Very small café style Indian restaurant.  Seems more for takeout than sit down but there are a few small tables with no ambiance.   

The menu posted above the counter has lots of options, but just lists a bunch of Indian dish names under general headings of what kind of meat is in them.  (or vegetarian)  If you are not familiar with the names, you really won't know what the dish is and asking them to describe all the dishes I was interested in was tiring for both of us.  Definitely would help to have a short description menu.  

As for the food itself, it was a mix.  The chicken curries (tikka masala and butter) were good.  The samosas were just ok.  Not that crispy, and a very mushy potato mixture inside without much flavor.  Fluffy bland rice.  The naan bread was very good.  The two sauces they offered were a super minty and a little too sweet sauce and a very sweet slightly spicy sauce.   

Prices seemed a bit steep for the entrées, around $10 each.  However the portions are actually quite large, so would easily feed two hungry people with the sides that are included.   Appetizers were reasonable prices and good portions too.   Vegetable pakora was very good.

Overall, just ok.

The chicken

data.title: Very good for breakfast buffet and take outs too
data.text: Been here a couple of times for breakfast. The buffet is very good with a variety of items: idli, poori, dosa, vada, upma, pongal (hot) and bisibeli bath. I also tried their take out menu - decent food at reasonable price.

data.title: Great take away Indian food!
data.text: Love the samosas, chicken biryani and naan bread. Small restaurant that specializes in take out. Great Indian food.

data.title: Nice Indian food
data.text: Ordered Curry Lamb. Very nice. Plate and silverware are real nice. Small place and not so up scale but food is good. Pop and mom restaurant and very nice people.

data.title: Best Indian Food This Side of London!
data.text: Was visiting my son and his family in Flower Mound recently, and this restaurant had been recommended to my daughter in law by a bunco friend of hers, so we gave it a try and got take-out one evening.  Indian food is my favorite in the entire world, being spoiled by living in London for several years, but even mediocre Indian has been very difficult to find even in stateside, large metros, such as Houston or New York City.  I KNOW what great Indian food is, and although I try it anywhere I can find it, I simply haven't found anything I got truly excited about until we tried Curry's.  Folks, this is FABULOUS Indian food, the best I've had anywhere this side of London!  I had the Shrimp Saag, and my kids had the Chicken Tikka Masala and Paneer Tikka Masala.  We also had an order of Okra Fry, which was out of this world!!  Every bite of every dish was truly spectacular, with perfectly balanced spices and flavors.  These people really know what they are doing, and it is totally authentic.  Highly, highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves Indian, and definitely to anyone who has never before tried Indian -- you won't find any better than this!  The physical location and interior decor aren't super appealing, but don't let that turn you off.  I can't wait to go back to Flower Mound and to Curry's!!

data.title: Authentic South Indian Food ...
data.text: I have visited Curry's a number of times over the past few months. I have placed carry-out orders (for lunch or Dinner) in the past. More recently, I have visited them for the weekend breakfast buffet, which includes a variety of South Indian breakfast delicacies. I find the breakfast buffet to be quite good.

data.title: "Delicious food"
data.text: Curry's is one of our favorite place. Vegetable samosas are best in town. We loved Chicken Dum Biryani as well. Mostly we have used takeout service. You can place your order over the phone.Very friendly staff. Definitely a place to try out delicious Indian food.

data.title: great Indian food
data.text:
Excellent Tikka Masala, samosas and naan.  The Tikka Masala sauce is the best i've ever tasted.  We split an order between 2 people because the portion is large.

It is mostly a takeout place, but they have several self-serve tables.  Extremely nice staff.  Has quickly become a go-to spot for our family.

data.title: Wonderful Indian food in Flower Mound, TX
data.text: Curry's has wonderful food with several south Indian specialties.  We had the vegetable samosas for an appetizer.  They arrived fresh from the fryer, crispy and filled with potatoes and mixed vegetables.  They were accompanied by two sauces: tamarind and mint.  Next came our two main courses:  Spinach Chicken and Chana Masala.  The chicken dish was a generous portion of chicken thigh meat cooked in a flavorful spinach puree.  The Chana Masala was a wonderful chickpea dish cooked in a spicy tomato sauce.  We had one side of rice and a basket of naan.  A superb meal for two right around $20.  Give this small place a try!  We hope to return soon for the Sunday breakfast buffet!
